changelog.info: Use the new USB vendor and product IDs assigned to Hughski Limited by the USB Implementers Forum, Inc.

Switch to using a measurement mode of DURATION by default which uses the pulse width triggered on any edge rather than counting the number of positive edges over a set time interval. This improves accuracy, and lowers quantisation errors by an order of magnitude when taking samples of dark patches.
Add commands to get and set the measurement mode. This is not stored in EEPROM and so has to be set after each re-plug event.
Send full HID packets as the OS X and Microsoft HID stacks verify that incoming transfers have the correct size. Many thanks to Vernon Tang for working out the problem.
Switch to using make to generate the firmware using the microchip toolchain on Linux, or optionally sdcc.
changelog.warning: You need to check that any client accessing the hardware has colorhug-client 0.1.12 or newer installed.

changelog.info: Return with an error when a non-factory calibration matrix is installed in slot 0 or when a user-matrix has no capabilities.

Return with an error when the dark calibration is impossibly high which could have been set when the user manually ran: $ colorhug-cmd set-dark-offsets using versions of colorhug-client less than 0.1.11.
Add a self test device command that can be used to check the ColorHug PCB automatically at manufacture time.
Apply the postscale when doing TakeReadings so that we can use it for profiling without using the unity matrix trick. This allows dispread -yR to work correctly.
When the device starts up, show the leds fading in and out.
Upgrade the embedded MCHPFSUSB library from 2.9a to 2.9e.
Do not re-enumerate on the USB bus when the client issues an incomplete request, just return the original command with an error set. Resetting the bus does not allow us to debug the failure.

Add commands to get and set the remote profile hash on the device. This allows calibration clients to save the profile to a RESTful web service and then easily retrieve the profile on another system, either Linux, Apple OS X or Microsoft Windows.
Add a new command to take 30 sequential measurements to allow the client tools to work out the device stability over a short amount of time.
Add firmware errata functionality to fix any ColorHug devices that have got swapped LEDs.

Take multiple pulse counts from the sensor and increase the integral time by up to a factor of 4 for very black samples. This improves the accuracy of the readings when measuring dark patches without slowing down bright patches.
Add commands to get and set an optional owner name and email.
changelog.warning: You need to check that any client accessing the hardware has colorhug-client 0.1.5 or newer installed. If older versions are used then timeout errors may cause the calibration to fail when reading very dark patches.

changelog.info: Do not lock up the device if the host crashes mid-read. This should also fix using the device in HID mode which is needed for driver-less operation in Windows and OSX.

Make the black readings more precise by waiting for the first pulse before starting the timing loop and use the integral period up until the last rising edge. This should remove the small color tints for very low light readings.
Always use the factory XYZ calibration as well as the ccmx matrix when getting readings.
Allow setting the lost-or-stolen flag when in firmware mode.
Return the correct error if the EEPROM unlock code was incorrect.
Add a new command GetHardwareVersion.
Multiply the dRGB values by the post-scale before using the calibration matrix.
Add calibration remapping functionality to be able to specify default matrixes for LCD, CRT and projectors.
Use a better packed float multiplication algorithm to improve XYZ measurement accuracy.
Add a calibration matrix display type bitfield to each calibration record so the user can't match LCD matrices to projectors and vice versa.
Initial firmware release
